question_title: What will be the value of "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 3-Month Constant Maturity, Quoted on an Investment Basis" on 2026-02-10?
summary: The 3-month Treasury yield (DGS3MO) should remain highly stable around current levels of 3.66-3.67% given: (1) Fed just held rates at 3.50-3.75% on Jan 28; (2) no FOMC meeting until March 17-18; (3) 3-month yields are tightly anchored to Fed policy. The yield varied only 4 basis points (3.66-3.70%) over the past week. The Feb 6 jobs report could cause minor movement, but short-term rates are largely set until the next Fed meeting. My distribution is centered at ~3.66% with modest uncertainty bands appropriate for this stable, anchored financial instrument.

factors.description: Fed held rates at 3.50-3.75% on Jan 28, 2026 - the 3-month yield is anchored to Fed policy and should stay close to current 3.67% level
No FOMC meeting until March 17-18 (well after Feb 10 resolution) - no policy change possible to move rates significantly
Recent yield highly stable: 3.66-3.70% range over past week (only 4 bps movement) - extreme stability supports narrow forecast range
Jobs report on Feb 6 before resolution could cause minor movement if significantly surprising - main catalyst for any deviation from current levels
Market could begin pricing March meeting expectations based on economic data - slight upward bias if inflation remains elevated
